data.title: Dry Spring
data.description: The Dry Spring is located in the Vrdnik settlment called Stara kolonija (Old Colony), where its also called Dobra voda (Good water).

data.title: Karaša Beach
data.description: Plaža na Karašu je poznato kupalište na Dunavu. Spas od vrućine na tom mestu leti najčešće traže meštani Beočina.

data.title: Debeli Cer Quarry
data.description: The old limestone quarry Debeli cer is located near Andrevlje and today is a sightseeing point and eagle feeding ground.

data.title: Kamenički Park
data.description: Across the Danube from the Strand, just by Sremska Kamenica, spreads the largest picnic area of Fruška Gora, and the largest park in Novi Sad.

data.title: Babin Guz Spring
data.description: The spring is located near the Dubočaš stream, northwest from Vrdnik on the road towards Zmajevac.

data.title: Stručica Monument Site
data.description: The Stručica monument got its name from the part of the Rakovac region it’s located in. It is dedicated to the fallen fighters.

data.title: Lazin vir
data.description: Lazin Vir is a place of pride for the Vrdnik locals. The deep forest shade, small waterfall, spring and picnic area make this place truly special.

data.title: Šuljamačka glavica
data.description: According to legend, the first grape vines on Fruška Gora were planted in Šuljamačka Glavica, back in the Roman days.

data.title: Privina Glava Monastery
data.description: A monastery dedicated to the holy angels Mihailo and Gavrilo, it was raised in the XV century. There's a stream and a spring nearby.

data.title: Orlove Stene
data.description: Sharp and pointed rocks below were made by sedimentation bellow earth, which at one time surfaced.

data.title: Vezirac Memorial Site
data.description: Vezirac Hill sits at the foot of Fruška gora, between Sremski Karlovci and Petrovaradin. It is best known as the location of the memorial to the Battle.

data.title: Vranjaš Spring
data.description: The spring is mentioned in II century b.c. as an aqueduct that supplied water to ancient Sirmium, and above it is a church and monastery.

data.title: Royal Garden
data.description: A former botanical garden that now echoes with the laughter of kids and frolicing pets.

data.title: Lipovača Picnic Area
data.description: A spring site of lively spirits, with interesting pathways, bungalows, and meadows, is located near Berkasovo and is a favourite spot for people from Šiđ.

data.title: Iriški Venac Picnic Area
data.description: The most famous intersection on Fruška Gora is where Partisan Road and the Ruma – Novi Sad highway meet. There are many camps and picnic areas in the...

data.title: Vrdnik Monastery
data.description: The Vrdnička Ravanica is the only monastery in a populated area. With a rich historical heritage it enriches this small place at the foot of Fruška Gora.

data.title: Sveti Đurđe Spring
data.description: The dreamlike scenery of a forest path enclosed with a wooden fence will charm you as you reach this spring, situated in the vicinity of Papratski Do.

data.title: Branko’s Grave
data.description: The memorial on top of Stražilovo is dedicated to the famous Serbian Romantic poet, Branko Radičević.

data.title: Fruška Gora Hotel
data.description: A hotel not far from Ležimir, a place where people enjoyed serene nature, was left to ruin during the nineties and is now used by fans of paintball.

data.title: Kuveždin Monastery
data.description: A monastery dedicated to Sveti Sava and his father Stefan Nemanja, built in the XVI century, is in a narrow valley surrounded by three hills, near Divoš.

data.title: Orlovo Bojište Lookout
data.description: Orlovo bojište is a former quarry, where you’ll catch a breathtaking view of Fruška Gora.

data.title: The Roman City
data.description: At the very edge of the Danube, in Čortanovačka forest, lie the ruins of a Roman military fortress Castra Herculis.

data.title: Popovica Spring
data.description: A soft stream flows from a spring nestled in forest.

data.title: Vrdnik Tower
data.description: It's on top of a lonely hill, overgrown with thick forest, and has been vigilantly overlooking Vrdnik for a long, long time.

data.title: Grgeteg Monastery
data.description: According to legend, Zmaj Ognjeni Vuk founded Grgeteg Monastery for his blind father in the 15th century. It is located in Grgeteg by the forest.

data.title: Valley of Chestnuts
data.description: Valley of Chestnuts, is located in Čerević, near the children’s resort “Testera”, and Andrevlje resort.

data.title: Vranjaš Monastery
data.description: A wooden church built from norwegian white pine and fir. Part of a beautiful ambient of the youngest monastery on Fruška Gora dedicated to St. Vasilije Ostroški

data.title: Jelica Spring
data.description: Near the Đipša monastery lies a road that leads over the Gologuz plateau to a spring in its foot.

data.title: Brankovac Picnic Area
data.description: A great meadow and wide pass in this picnic area let you find your own spot for fun. There are forest roads nearby that lead to Beočin monastery and...

data.title: Crveni Čot
data.description: The highest top of Fruška Gora with its impressive 539m in height, was used as a radio/tv signal tower spot, and has amazing views.

data.title: Šišatovac Monastery
data.description: Located in Šišatovac and dedicated to the Birth of the Virgin, Šišatovac Monastery will charm any visitor with its harmony and orderliness.

data.title: Andrevlje Picnic Area
data.description: Located at one of the most beautiful parts of Fruška Gora, with a big meadow surrounded by forest like an island by sea, this picnic area is great for relaxing.

data.title: Staro Hopovo Spring
data.description: Near the Staro Hopovo monastery lies the spring above which sits a small rustic stone chapel.

data.title: Old Church of Saint George
data.description: There are remnants of an medieval church in Ledinci, at the small plateau on the slopes of the hill, where today’s weekend-village Klisa is.

data.title: Kosača Meadow
data.description: Surrounded by forest and rich with springs, with feeders and drinkers, this meadow is a true oasis for Fruška Gora's flora and fauna.

data.title: Rugovo Memorial
data.description: A memorial fountain was built not far from Čortanovačka beach, as a lasting memory of the six sailors who lost their lives on the ship Rugovo.

data.title: Stražilovo Picnic Area
data.description: Stražilovo is a peak of Fruška gora, at 321 meters above sea level. It is a well-known resort on Fruška gora, just 4 km away from Sremski Karlovci

data.title: Velika Remeta Monastery
data.description: At the far eastern part of Fruška Gora lies the Velika Remeta monastery. The diverse selection of scenery attracts more and more visitors.

data.title: The Osovlje Picnic Area
data.description: The rest area is property of NIS (Naftagas), and was built in 1965 for company purposes. It is no longer in use.

data.title: Papratski Do
data.description: A local site under first level of protection is also the habitat of indigenous forest beech, oak and scum, and a community of ferns by which it was named.

data.title: Duško's Lookout
data.description: A gorgeous viewpoint stretching over Karlovci, the Danube, and Bačka. This spot was dedicated to the serbian poet Duško Trifunović.

data.title: Russian Hero Memorial Grave
data.description: The russian hero and holder of the Medal of the Patriotic War II order and the Medal of the Red Star. Sacrificed his life in the fight against fascists at Frušk

data.title: Kraljev Izvor Picnic Area
data.description: A small picnic area near Crveni Čot, including Kraljevac Spring, that is ideal for a short break, because it is right next to Partisan road.

data.title: Spitzer Castle
data.description: The late 20th century Spitzer Castle is one of the most significant examples of Eclecticism in Vojvodinian architecture.

data.title: Danube's Lookout
data.description: A splendid view of Novi Sad and the Danube on one side, with Fruška Gora on the other.

data.title: Jazak Monastery
data.description: Situated within the slopes of Fruška Gora, Jazak Monastery was built in the 18th century, when the Great Serb Migration brought the relics of Uroš the Weak here

data.title: Grgurevci Cave
data.description: A cave discovered in 1961. by Đorđe Mirković from Grgurevci, is a geological phenomenon in which fossil remains of rodents and bats were found.

data.title: Četiri Kamena Spring
data.description: Not far from Čortanovci beach, just by the mountain lodge, sits the Četiri Kamena (four stones) spring.

data.title: Podvezirac Lake
data.description: A small, lonely lake, hidden behind the fields of Sremski Karlovci, seems stifled in the scenery.

data.title: Recreational Airfield
data.description: The Airfield was meant for recreational and touristic flights, and it has been bringing aviation enthusiasts together for many years.

data.title: Popovica Picnic Area
data.description: Popovica, one of Fruška Gora’s mountain points is also the start area of the Fruška gora marathon.

data.title: Stari Majdan Spring
data.description: The spring site that's 1,4km away from Zmajevac towards Rakovac is a popular destination because it's close to the road.

data.title: Đipša Monastery
data.description: A monastery dedicated to Saint Nikola, built by the end of the XV century, is at the southern slopes of Fruška Gora in a beautiful valley surrounded by forest.

data.title: Kudoš Lake
data.description: The lake, with its rich flora and fauna, with remarkable fish and birds will delight with its beauty every nature lover.

data.title: Bobelik Meadow Picnic Area
data.description: Bobelik Meadow, also known as Tepsija, is lovated by the road that leads to Ležimir, near the crossroads with the Partizanski road.

data.title: Kišelez Meadow
data.description: One of he most beautiful meadows on Fruška Gora

data.title: Jazak Spring
data.description: Jazak Spring is located on a small private estate right before the monastery, and its water is well known for its quality. A small pool completes the ambient.

data.title: Beočin Monastery
data.description: Dedicated to the Ascention of Christ and adorned by a copy of the Versailles park, Beočin monastery represents a unique architectural site.

data.title: Dumbovački Waterfalls
data.description: The forest roads that lead to this naturally occuring phenomenon on Fruška Gora, hidden in thick forest, represent a true challenge for rare visitors.

data.title: Kapavica Lake
data.description: The smallest reservoir at Fruška Gora is deep within the forest near the Vizić village. It's filled by the local spring and groundwater.

data.title: Borkovac Picnic Area
data.description: A resort near the Borkovac lake, with luscious vegetation, a stream, a park, and a trim-track with wooden exercise equipment, is an ideal place to relax.

data.title: Krušedol Monastery
data.description: Krušedol Monastery, built in the 16th century and dedicated to the Annunciation of the Holy Virgin, is also the mausoleum of many historically significant Serbs

data.title: Ciganski logor
data.description: The Gypsy camp is a picnic area by Partizanski road. It is marked by two monuments dedicated to Partisan fighters and their war tactics.

data.title: Petkovica Monastery
data.description: In a valley next to the Remeta spring, near Šišatovac, is the Petkovica monastery. The monastery surroundings, witha  spring and a fishpond, radiate calmness.

data.title: Široki Do Spring
data.description: Down the meadow next to the Lepinjica monument, on the brink of the forest, is the Široki Do springs.

data.title: Zmaj Museum
data.description: Serbia’s great poet, Jovan Jovanović Zmaj, spent the last years of his life in this house. In 1933 it was adapted and opened to visitors.

data.title: Tekeniš Meadow
data.description: There’s a great view of the Fruška Gora glade from the spacious meadow in Grabovo.

data.title: Kraljevac Spring
data.description: Kraljevac can be found to the right of the Kraljev Izvor Picnic Area, down the timber stairs.

data.title: Novo Hopovo Monastery
data.description: The monastery, allegedly founded by Đurađ Branković at the beginning of the 16th century, is dedicated to Saint Nikola. There is a small lake in the vicinity.

data.title: Vila Ravne
data.description: A symbol of the opulence in this part of Fruška gora, Villa Ravne takes us back to the good old times.

data.title: Vranjaš Lake
data.description: The lake near the Mađelos village is an ideal location for those who love sports fishing, and it's near the Vranjaš spring, and the Sveti Vasilije Ostroški...

data.title: Srem House (Trščara)
data.description: Many call it the Savić’s house, or the Srem house. It used to belong to the rich merchant family Savić.

data.title: Marčibanji-Karačonji Castle
data.description: Near the Danube coast is the castle which first belonged to the Marčibanji family. It was built by the end of the 18th and the beginning of the 19th century.

data.title: Dobrodol Lake
data.description: Near the Dobrodol village is the same-named lake whose clear water and bountiful food make this a heavenly spot for sports fishing and relaxation.

data.title: Hajdučki Spring
data.description: Gora and the Danube marshes used to be the perfect hiding spots for hajduks. This spring was named to honor the hajduks and Laza Harambaša.

data.title: Testera Picnic Area
data.description: A resort snuggled into the natural ambient of Fruška Gora forest is about 6km from Čerević. There's the resort geard towards recreational education in nature.

data.title: Staro Hopovo Monastery
data.description: Isolated and surrounded by a pine forest, the Staro Hopovo monastery is surely one of the smallest and most memorable at Fruška Gora.

data.title: Šelevrenac Lake
data.description: The lake is in private property of MK Komerc, but was turned into a private nature reserve, for fishing, sports, recreation, and is near the Maradik village.

data.title: Mošin grave
data.description: Mošin grave is a picnic area dedicated to the partisan fighter Boško Sanadrović Moša, a member of the 3. Vojvodina Division.

data.title: Bruje Lake
data.description: A lake that's been attracting campers, fishermen, cyclists and swimmers for years, is home to rare birds and is filled by spring water from Banja.

data.title: Koruška
data.description: Koruška is near the Susek village at Danube's bank, popular among local fishermen.

data.title: Rakovac Monastery
data.description: The monastery was, according to legend, built by a chamberlain of despot Jovan Branković called Raka in the XV century, at the same spot where he shot a deer.

data.title: Beli Majdan Cave
data.description: A cave made by quarrying stone, has a 4m high main hall, and a road inside that leads above the hall's vault, where there's a striking view of Fruška Gora

data.title: Borkovac Lake
data.description: A lake near Ruma, on the southern slopes of Fruška Gora, an ideal destination for all lovers of nature and sport fishing, adorned by the ecological Aqua Camp.

data.title: Virevi Spring
data.description: This area spotted with springs is a real phenomenon located between the villages of Divoš and Bingula.

data.title: Perina Pećina Cave
data.description: Perina Pećina cave, one of the unique sites of its kind at Fruška Gora, is hidden deep in forest.

data.title: Bingula Lake
data.description: If you're passing by the road between Erdevik and Bingula, you'll surely notice a small lake, which water can be crystal clear in early spring.

data.title: Mala Remeta Monastery
data.description: The Monastery was founded by king Dragutin Nemanjić, and dedicated to the Intercession of the Theotokos. It is an example of Serbian-Byzantine architecture.

data.title: Sophia's Springs
data.description: At the crossroad between Partisan rode and the Ležimir-Sviloš road is the "medicinal magnetic field" site which is believed to cure diseases.

data.title: Ljukovo Lake
data.description: A lake, that spreads the length of the Jarkovci village, is home to diverse animal species, and at its bank is count Pajačević's summer house.

data.title: Jabuka Spring
data.description: A gravel road from Jabuka picnic area leads to the same-named spring, surrounded by a monument with a staircase leading to the spring source.

data.title: Popov Čot Picnic Area
data.description: A picnic area with an ethno house, Vojvodinian cottage and fenced yard, just before the turn to the village of Grgurevci.

data.title: Ubavac Spring
data.description: The spring dedicated to St. Demetrios was built in 1899. According to legend, it has healing powers, the most prominent of which is the power to heal sight.

data.title: Berkasovo Monastery
data.description: A newer monastery dedicated to Saint Parascheva of the Balkans, also the location of a healing spring, and the westernmost monastery of Fruška Gora

data.title: Banja Spring
data.description: A spring whose water prides itself with good mineral content with lots of iodine and sulfur and a constant 13 degrees, is located near the lake Bruja.

data.title: Isaija Parivodski Anchoress
data.description: This unique part of cultural heritage was built by monks from the Rakovac monastery in the 18th century.

data.title: Rakovac Quarry
data.description: The quarry was founded in 1937. with the exploitation of trachyte, a volcanic rock, and represents a scar on the face of Fruska Gora.

data.title: Zmajevac Picnic Area
data.description: A resort in Vrdnik, also a viewpoint with one of the most beautiful views of Srem, regularly stops and enchants passers-by.

data.title: Archeological Sight Gradina
data.description: The remains of former buildings attest the violent and rich history of the area.

data.title: Pavlov Spring
data.description: This spring is located at the end of the village of Neštin, and it is special due to its orderliness.

data.title: Sveti Đorđe Spring
data.description: Deep in the cool shade of Fruška Gora's forest, about 2km from Banja, the Sveti Đorđe spring offers respite to locals and travelers alike.

data.title: Trešnjevac Meadow
data.description: This meadow is situated in the forest near Sviloš, and it is a fenced enclosure for deer to graze in.

data.title: Valley of Peace Spring
data.description: This spring holds true to its name, the Valley of Peace - the area around it is absolutely serene.

data.title: TV Tower on Iriški Venac
data.description: The biggest tower on Fruška Gora is an indispensable part of the Novi Sad panorama, and is also home to the most remarkable view of Novi Sad, Srem, Bačka.

data.title: Neven Spring
data.description: The Neven spring is located near Rakovac. You can get to it by taking an easy stroll from Stari Ledinci over Kesten.

data.title: Međeš Lake
data.description: Međeš lake, near Šatrinci, with its beach, volleyball field, table tennis, and small restaurant is a fine place for some rest and relaxation.

data.title: Ravne Meadow
data.description: This beautiful, spacious meadow is located in a forest near the main road. It belongs to Villa Ravne.

data.title: Neštin Lookout
data.description: The Kuluštra of this lookout (a former Roman fortification), provides a spectacular view of the Danube and its six islands, Bačka Palanka and Ilok.

data.title: Mandalina Ćuprija Spring
data.description: This spring site is located deep in the woods unter a large oak tree, and sits right next to the bridge it got its name from.

data.title: Geological Locality Grgeteg
data.description: One of the few, rare places in the Pannonian Plain where sediments are built in continuity. Contains fossil remains of molluscs.

data.title: Belilo Spring
data.description: This spring source is located not that far from the main road that goes through the village, near the Roman Catholic church in the same-named street.

data.title: Široke Ledine Picnic Area
data.description: This gorgeous picnic area is located near the Bešenovački Prnjavor, near the Mala Remeta monastery.

data.title: Tri Oraja Spring
data.description: If you venture across Kosača meadow you'll end up at the spring Tri oraja. The name comes from the local nickname "oraj", and means three walnut trees.

data.title: Kesten Lookout
data.description: From the Kesten viewpoint you can see a majestic view of Novi Sad and the southern slopes of Fruška Gora.

data.title: Turkish Well
data.description: This spring is located in the fields of Lug, near the playground, but whimsically hidden from prying eyes.

data.title: Grandpa’s Spring
data.description: At the exit from the Bešenovački Prnjavor, next to the main bend, left behind the farm in the valley, you’ll find the Grandpa’s Spring

data.title: Kozarica Spring
data.description: The spring near Čortanovci forest is not far from the Danube shore, and it is an important landmark of Čortanovci.

data.title: Vilina Vodica Spring
data.description: The spring in the heart of the forest is 3km from Bukovac, and a must-see stop for mountaineers and nature lovers.

data.title: Pištinci Village
data.description: An abandoned micro village in the farmlands of Srem, about a kilometre away from Bingula, with its lively surroundings resembles an old, rich, Vojvodinian...

data.title: Rohalj Bases Picnic Area
data.description: A favoruite picnic destination for people living in Divoš and nearby villages, with a view of the Srem plains. The Kuveždin and Đipša monasteries are close by.

data.title: Živa Voda Spring
data.description: This inexhaustible spring, discovered during the oil rush, is the farthermost from the forest, around 5 km away from Bingula.

data.title: Čalma Lakes I, II, III
data.description: Three lakes were made in the seventies from accumulated waters, filled by rich hydro-graphical network of Srem, give off a sense of a true nature resort.

data.title: Jabuka Picnic Area
data.description: A picnic area, set on a slightly wavy plateau, is by the Partizanski road, between Letenka and Crveni Čot. There's the same-named spring nearby.

data.title: Sveta Petka Trnova Spring
data.description: A spring located inside a chapel built by the local weekenders and dedicated to Saint Parascheva resonates spirituality, warmth and tranquility.

data.title: Letenka Picnic Area
data.description: Located in the central part of Fruška Gora is one of the largest, most popular picnic areas. Letenka is the perfect destination for fresh air and some exercise.

data.title: Ćoravac Spring
data.description: Locals call it the best spring site around, and add: "She who gets drunk from the waters from Ćoravac, stays in Ljuba."

data.title: Church of Saint Rudolph
data.description: Locals still call this old church, deteriorated with the passage of time, "German". The ruined altar and dome stand in witness to this building's tumultuous...

data.title: Savina Memorial-Fountain Spring
data.description: A spring of drinkable water Sveti Nikola and a fountain built by a local man from Neradin called Sava, is at the Irig-Krušedol road near the turn for Neradin.

data.title: Lepinjica Monument
data.description: The tender age of 19 the young partisan and fighter Radinka Vitasović sacrificed herself for her country. This monument at Fruška Gora is dedicated to her.

data.title: Ledinci Lake
data.description: A gem on Fruška Gora that enriched it from 1999. to 2009. The lake has since been drained and is waiting for an ore quarry.

data.title: Pinkijev Grave
data.description: The dirt road leading to a memorial site dedicated to the national hero Pinki is half way between Bešenovački Prnjavor and the crossroad at Crveni Čot.

data.title: Belan Fishpond
data.description: The Belan fishpont is part of the Belan tourist establishment. You can stay the night, explore the four fish ponds, taste the best fish dishes and try your...

data.title: Dusa Spring
data.description: Hidden in the shadow of a walnut tree near the Moharač lake, Dusa spring is a true oasis in this part of Vojvodina.

data.title: Bešenovo Monastery
data.description: A monastery dedicated to the Holy Archangels Michael and Gabriel, destroyed during the Second World War. Near it is a wooden chapel under a 300-year-old linden.

data.title: Moharač Spring
data.description: The cold waters of the Moharač spring, located beneath the dam of the same-named lake, gives refuge during the hot summer days.

data.title: Popovica Lake
data.description: A lake of emerald green serves as a fish hatchery near Popovica.

data.title: Astali Picnic Area
data.description: A small picnic area hidden in the forest near the Partizanski road. This place is the control point of the Fruška Gora marathon KT02.

data.title: Begov Spring
data.description: If you take the summer path from Čalma to Manđelos, you will come across the spring filling the Čalman lakes, a real oasis amidst the arable fields of Srem.

data.title: Šućakov Spring
data.description: A spring dedicated to the fighters in WW2, whose waters are drunk by game and sheep herds and nearby drinkers, is near the weekend-village Stari Divoš.

data.title: Čalambir Spring
data.description: A spring site near the Belan tourism farms, situated deep within a forest; becomes a watering hole for animals when water overflows.

data.title: Tree Nursery
data.description: Not far from Beočin Monastery lies the Tree Nursery for ornamental trees and shrubs of the National Park Fruška Gora.

data.title: Moharač Lake
data.description: Surrounded by wineyards, fields and a forest, Moharač Lake enchants with its diversity, tranquility and beauty, and is a haven for all true nature lovers.

data.title: Martinov Do Spring
data.description: The first in a line of springs at this site that counts seven springs in total, is near the tourist estate Belan, snugged in a small cove.

data.title: Dolina Spring
data.description: The main crossroad at the Vizić village is also where the Dolina spring is, too. From this beautiful, walled fountain water flows even during droughts.

data.title: Sot Lake
data.description: One of the most beautiful lakes on Fruška Gora, fish rich and with a vivid landscape is near Sot, about 10km away from Šid

data.title: Jabuka Monument Site
data.description: The Jabuka monument site is part of the picnic area.

data.title: Zvečan Spring
data.description: A regulated spring Zvečan is on the road towards the Ledinci lake. The forest path from the spring leads to the beautiful viewpoint of the lake.

data.title: Sloboda Memorial Site
data.description: The monument site with a high obelisk and a woman on top representing liberty by author Sreten Stojanović, was rasied in honor of the fallen soldiers during...

data.title: Kamenolom Memorial Site
data.description: A monumental site, made as a mosaic, dedicated to the fallen soldiers and victimes in WW2, sits beside a road that leads to Zmajevac.

data.title: Majdan Crveni Spring
data.description: A spring, walled and built by local hunters in 1986. It's located deep inside a forest, near the Belan tourism farms.

data.title: Beli Kamen Lake
data.description: The Beli Kamen Lake, Fruška Gora's jewel, which contrasts with the whiteness of the stone terraces and resembles the Mediterranean a little.

data.title: Perinac Spring
data.description: Perinac spring is in the lively albeit small village Stara Bingula, at the end of the main street. Although it's in private property entrance is allowed.

data.title: Čortanovci Beach
data.description: As one of the most beautiful beaches along the Danube, it augments the fascinating Čortanovci Park.

data.title: Vrbara Spring
data.description: One of the many springs at the end of the Peka Dapevića street. It resembles a bunker from the WW II era.

data.title: Kamarište Spring
data.description: At the end of the Vizić village, by way of the dirt road that passes a playground, lies the Kamarište spring at the end of a local farmer's field.

data.title: Fishpond Jelica
data.description: Near the Đipša monastery, there's a road that leads over the Gologuz plateau to the small fishpond at its base.

data.title: Orašje Spring
data.description: A spring whose water flows freely from a concrete base. Located near the end of the Ljuba village, right bellow the bend on the left side of the plum orchard.

data.title: Cigljana Spring
data.description: The most used spring by the locals, because of its easy reach by car. Great for catching your breath and enjoying the scenery.

data.title: Kamenolom Spring
data.description: This spring is right next to the memorial park dedicated to the National Liberation War. The locals say it's not safe for drinking.

data.title: Ljukovo Spring
data.description: The spring is located not far from the dam, near the spillway channel. It has a very strong jet of water, even in dry periods.

data.title: The Rohalj Bases Memorial Site
data.description: The Rohalj Bases memorial site is part of the picnic area.

data.title: Parcovljev Spring
data.description: This spring can be found in the weekend-resort Stari Divoš, not far from Partisan road.

data.title: Kunjat Spring
data.description: About a kilometre by way of a summer road, nearby the picnic area and monument of the Rohalj base, is the Kunjat spring.

data.title: Ivan Stambolić Monument
data.description: This unfortunately sad place, where a life was extinguished, is a reminder of hard and oppressive times.
